We hope you had a great team day on Monday.

 

Following our recent discussions regarding the furniture currently stored at the DIP warehouse, we would now like to begin planning the phased delivery to the Palm residence.

 

With your kind support, our goal is to coordinate the deliveries in a smooth manner, allowing sufficient time for each step: collection, delivery, unpacking, inspection, placement, and reporting. Given the delicacy of these pieces and the high level of finishing at the residence, we wish to approach the process with care and pace, allowing breathing room between each delivery phase.

 

We are currently liaising with Stone Haven and Khansaheb to ensure all passages within the residence are cleared to facilitate smooth access across all floors. This will allow furniture to be delivered and positioned directly into their final locations without obstruction.

 

In parallel, may we kindly ask to initiate the programming with E-Movers? Specifically, we would like them to review the consignments in the warehouse and begin planning their logistics—including manpower, trucks, tooling, and forklifts. Please also ensure the necessary extended passes (for both staff and vehicles) are arranged with the relevant teams.

We hope you had a great team day on Monday.

		 

		Following our recent discussions regarding the furniture currently stored at the DIP warehouse, we would now like to begin planning the phased delivery to the Palm residence.

		 

		With your kind support, our goal is to coordinate the deliveries in a smooth manner, allowing sufficient time for each step: collection, delivery, unpacking, inspection, placement, and reporting. Given the delicacy of these pieces and the high level of finishing at the residence, we wish to approach the process with care and pace, allowing breathing room between each delivery phase.

		 

		We are currently liaising with Stone Haven and Khansaheb to ensure all passages within the residence are cleared to facilitate smooth access across all floors. This will allow furniture to be delivered and positioned directly into their final locations without obstruction.

		 

		In parallel, may we kindly ask to initiate the programming with E-Movers? Specifically, we would like them to review the consignments in the warehouse and begin planning their logistics—including manpower, trucks, tooling, and forklifts. Please also ensure the necessary extended passes (for both staff and vehicles) are arranged with the relevant teams.

In parallel, may we kindly ask to initiate the programming with E-Movers? Specifically, we would like them to review the consignments in the warehouse and begin planning their logistics—including manpower, trucks, tooling, and forklifts. Please also ensure the necessary extended passes (for both staff and vehicles) are arranged with the relevant teams.

		 

		Below is the proposed delivery sequence. If any of these shipments are light and can be efficiently combined with another, please feel free to do so—provided it remains productive and economical. Kindly note we’ve intentionally placed Lux Lounger as the final delivery, as these items are for the garden, and we would prefer to keep them stored as long as possible.

		 

		Proposed Delivery Sequence

		 

		Delivery One: Cassina

		*	Drop ID# 172304 – Comm. Inv# V1202425238
		*	Drop ID# 172304 – Comm. Inv# V1202503669
		*	Drop ID# 172304 – Comm. Inv# V1202503669

		 

		Delivery Two: Fine Art

		*	E-Cart – Drop ID# 167054 – Comm. Inv# FC2863

		 

		Delivery Three: Living Divani

		*	AE_AI160130 – Packing List

		 

		Delivery Four: Nemo Group

		*	AE_AI160130 – Comm. Inv# 120E

		 

		Delivery Five: Lux Lounger

		*	Drop ID# 167063 – Comm. Inv# 2025-EXT-004

		 

		Additionally, could you kindly confirm if there are any shipments currently at sea or in the process of landing?

		 

		Looking forward to your thoughts and coordination on the above.

		 

		Kind regards,

		
		Linton

With your kind support, our goal is to coordinate the deliveries in a smooth manner, allowing sufficient time for each step: collection, delivery, unpacking, inspection, placement, and reporting. Given the delicacy of these pieces and the high level of finishing at the residence, we wish to approach the process with care and pace, allowing breathing room between each delivery phase.

		 

		We are currently liaising with Stone Haven and Khansaheb to ensure all passages within the residence are cleared to facilitate smooth access across all floors. This will allow furniture to be delivered and positioned directly into their final locations without obstruction.

		 

		In parallel, may we kindly ask to initiate the programming with E-Movers? Specifically, we would like them to review the consignments in the warehouse and begin planning their logistics—including manpower, trucks, tooling, and forklifts. Please also ensure the necessary extended passes (for both staff and vehicles) are arranged with the relevant teams.

		 

		Below is the proposed delivery sequence. If any of these shipments are light and can be efficiently combined with another, please feel free to do so—provided it remains productive and economical. Kindly note we’ve intentionally placed Lux Lounger as the final delivery, as these items are for the garden, and we would prefer to keep them stored as long as possible.

		 

		Proposed Delivery Sequence

		 

		Delivery One: Cassina
